### Major League Baseball run scoring trends


#### bayesball.blogspot.com

Earlier versions of the analysis of run scoring trends in Major League Baseball can be found on my blog bayesball.blogspot.com.  In reverse order of publication, they are:

* ["Major League Baseball run scoring trends with R's Lahman package"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2013/06/major-league-baseball-run-scoring.html), 2014-06-04
* ["MLB runs allowed by team; Or, How good were the Maddux/Glavine-era Braves?"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2013/02/mlb-runs-allowed-by-team.html), 2014-02-24
* ["Run production, one team at a time"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2013/02/run-production-one-team-at-time.html), 2013-02-17
* ["Comparing individual team run production; Or, The 2010 Mariners: How Bad Were They?"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2013/02/comparing-individual-team-run-production.html), 2013-02-02
* ["Trends in run scoring - comparing the leagues"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2012/08/trends-in-run-scoring-comparing-leagues.html), 2012-08-10
* ["Trends in run scoring, NL edition (more R)"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2012/07/trends-in-run-scoring-nl-edition-more-r.html), 2012-07-17
* ["Trends in AL run scoring (using R)"](http://bayesball.blogspot.ca/2012/07/trends-in-al-run-scoring-using-r.html), 2012-07-14
